title: Bug 2345: Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open
description: Bug 2345: Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: When following the steps provided in the description (1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor), selecting 'Default Text Editor' from the 'Open With' menu does not open a new editor for the test.xml file. Instead, the existing scripted resource editor example is reactivated.
EB: When following the steps provided in the description (1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor), selecting 'Default Text Editor' from the 'Open With' menu should open a new editor on the test.xml file, since the editor type is different.
SR:
1. Open the application.
2. Create a new basic project.
3. Create a new file named 'test.xml'.
4. Select 'test.xml' in the Navigator.
5. Right-click and choose 'Open With...'
6. From the 'Open With' menu, select 'Default Text Editor'.
7. Verify that a new editor for the 'test.xml' file is opened, indicating that the editor type was considered and a new editor of the correct type was used.
